Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: ஒறுத்தாரை ஒன்றாக வையாரே வைப்பர்பொறுத்தாரைப் பொன்போற் பொதிந்து.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: (The wise) will not at all esteem the resentful. They will esteem the patient just as the gold which they lay up with care.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A contrasting diptych. On the left, a resentful person ('ஒறுத்தார்') who has taken revenge is shown being disregarded by the wise; they are depicted as a worthless, crumbling clay statue that no one pays attention to.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, a patient person ('பொறுத்தார்') who has forborne an injury is shown. The wise are carefully and reverently wrapping this person in fine silks and placing them in a treasure chest, treating them like a precious golden idol ('பொன்போல் பொதிந்து').
Layered_Composition.Background: A hall of wisdom, where the judgment of the wise ('வையார்', 'வைப்பர்') is the ultimate measure of a person's worth.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The wise disregard the resentful as worthless, while they cherish and preserve the patient as they would the most precious gold.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The contrast between the crumbling clay statue and the cherished golden idol is a direct and powerful metaphor for the value judgment being made. The actions of the wise—ignoring one, carefully preserving the other—make the meaning explicit.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Valued vs. worthless, cherished, esteemed, disregarded.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The left side is dimly lit, dusty, and grey. The right side is illuminated by a warm, respectful light, with the rich colors of gold, silk, and polished wood.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A clear, comparative shot that presents the two fates side-by-side.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a strong textural contrast between the crumbling clay and the gleaming gold.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Dual lighting scheme to emphasize the contrast between worthlessness and preciousness.
